Code¶

averagingMethods.py¶

Functions and Script to calculate various averages from pressure rake data

project.averagingMethods.areaWeightedAvg(filename, hubRadius, casingRadius)¶

Returns a single area weighted average total pressure from rake data Each probe is assigned an annular sector, whose extents defined by the angles and radii midway between adjacent probes. Average pressure is found by weighing each probe pressure by their assigned annular sectors.

Parameters:

  • filename (string) – The name of the .csv file containing pressure probe data. Column Format: [Probe Number, Span, Theta(radians), Pressure). Must be in same folder as areaWeightedAverage.py

  • hubRadius (float) – Radius of hub outer edge

  • casingRadius (float) – Radius of casing inner edge

Returns:

A single averaged pressure value

Return type:

float

project.averagingMethods.circumferentialAverage(filename)¶

Returns circumferentially averaged total pressures from rake data. (One averaged value per span of probes)

Parameters:

filename (string) – The name of the .csv file containing pressure probe data. Column Format: [Probe Number, Span, Theta(radians), Pressure). Must be in same folder as areaWeightedAverage.py

Returns:

Array of average pressures for each span value (in order of increasing span)

Return type:

float array

project.averagingMethods.radialAverage(filename)¶

Returns radially averaged total pressures from rake data. (One averaged value per angle of probes)

Parameters:

filename (string) – The name of the .csv file containing pressure probe data. Column Format: [Probe Number, Span, Theta(radians), Pressure). Must be in same folder as areaWeightedAverage.py

Returns:

Array of average pressures for each theta value (in order of increasing theta)

Return type:

float array
